intro: Murdannia lineolata, commonly known as the narrow-veined mouse-ear, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Commelinaceae. It is a small, herbaceous annual that typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. The plant features small, ovate leaves with prominent midveins and produces tiny, white or pale green flowers arranged in dense clusters. Its botanical characteristics include a fibrous root system and a short, creeping stem. Murdannia lineolata is often found in temperate regions and is known for its delicate appearance and ecological significance in wetland ecosystems.
